decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): AA-TG-A006-0002 Proposed Basement Plan, AA-TG-A006-0003 Proposed GF Plan, AA-TG-A006-0004 Proposed FF Plan, AA-TG-A006-0005 Proposed SF Plan, AA-TG-A006-0006  Proposed RF Plan, AA-TG-A006-0007 Proposed Front Elevation, AA-TG-A006-0008 Proposed Rear Elevation, AA-TG-A006-0009 Proposed Side Elevation 1 and AA-TG-A006-0010 Proposed Side Elevation 2 and email received 30/8/2022 agreeing the safeguarding of Designated Archaeological Interest AreaThe Green, Southall
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, in the interest of proper planning.

| Prior to use, the shutters shall be installed with proprietary anti-vibration isolators to prevent structural or airborne noise being transmitted to noise sensitive occupiers and the closing mechanism shall be buffered to adequately silence the operation of the shutters.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers at the development site and at surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration or noise, in accordance with policy 1.1 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of London Plan 2021, the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) (Sections 2 and 12)
| The following standards and control measures shall be implemented during demolition and construction:
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays (no work on public holidays),

- notifications of works to interested parties and regular neighbour liaison,  - public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works in case of emergencies or complaints.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with policy 1.1 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of London Plan 2021, the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) (Section 2 and 12).
| At least 4 secure cycle parking spaces shall be provided on site and retained thereafter.
Reason: To encourage sustainable transport modes in accordance with National Planning Policy Framework (2021) - section 9, London Plan 2021 policy T5 and Ealing Sustainable Transport SPG.
| Refuse and recycling facilities as per Condition 2: approved plan  shall be provided on site and retained thereafter.

Reason: To encourage appropriatt wastend recycling faclities in accordance with National Planning Policy Framework (2021) - section 2, London Plan 2021 policies SI 7 and SI 8 and Ealing DM DPD policy EA
description: Single storey rear extension to existing commercial unit (Use Class A3) following the demolition of existing extension and rear outbuilding; creation of a new entrance and a staircase for existing first floor residential unit
